question: I am a t1 diabetic of 52 years.  I was diagnosed many years ago with gastroparesis.   I am allergic to REGLAN.  Cisapride and Zelnorm both worked well for me, but have been pulled from the market.  What is available to help gastric motility.  I have constant bloating and flatulance.  I take Cytotec, and acidophilus, but still have the constant bloating and passing gas numerable times a day.  It makes me so uncomfortable it is many time difficult to get to sleep and stay asleep all night.  My endocrine doctor recently adjusted my thyroid and I am on an insulin pump which has helped to stabilize my blood sugars.  These things have helped some, but minimally.  Is there anything new on the horizon or available to help with management of this so I can eat a diet that is healthy and enjoyable?
title: gastroparesis and T1 Diabetes
